Typically, the antibody is present at less than about 10 <sup>-7</sup> M, e.g. less than about 10 <sup>-8</sup> M、10 <sup>-9</sup> M、10 <sup>-10</sup> M、10 <sup>-11</sup> An equilibrium dissociation constant (KD) of M or less binds to the antigen. 
The smaller the equilibrium dissociation constant, the tighter the antibody-antigen binding, and the higher the affinity between the antibody and antigen.
